Posts.Title: COLD CAP OR NO COLD CAP?

Posts.Content: Hey smiffy2512 honestly the waiting part is the worse. I had to wait 2 weeks for my results in that time I only told close family. I was very sore for a few days after my biopsy. When I got my results I was in such a state but all went quickly from there. I then told my close friends & honestly it was the best thing I did as they have all been there for me to rant shout cry whatever. I told my oldest daughter which was soooo hard we cried ALOT but then I was like we will get thru this be a long journey but we will get there. Since then Ive met my oncologist key worker my chemo nurse sooo many wonderful ppl and the support u get on here is amazing. I've just had my 1st chemo session yesterday and I went and brought my wig today. I'm so sorry ur going thru this but honesty will get better once u know what's happening. I'd say still go on holiday relax have an amazing time xx
Posts.Title: Newbie with core biopsy question

Posts.Content: Hi I too was diagnosed in Feb and it seems to have all gone in quick motion. My husband hasn't coped very well had a lot of tears and tantrums and like u found very frustrating but slowly getting there. I found if I kept him involved he was ok and started to ask questions that has made us a bit better I have asked if he wants to come to one of my chemo sessions but he's not up for that. Ur husband will get there show him lots of love and hugs and make he's best dinner lol xx
